Carn a' Chlamain

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Carn a' Chlamain is a stony summit on the edge of a sweeping plateau on the edge of Glen Tilt. The usual approach is up this glen, its great beauty making this a fine walk.

 You have not climbed Carn a' Chlamain.

Region: Perthshire

Altitude: 963 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.22/5
Rating: 3.2/5 (81 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Carn a' Chlamain from Glen Tilt

Other routes and challenges

The position of Carn a' Chlamain means it is almost always ascended via Glen Tilt, though you could head further up the glen to beyond Forest Lodge before taking an older stalkers' path up to near the summit.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Perthshire Hotels

Perthshire B&B

Perthshire Cottages

Perthshire Hostels
